DOC.brief_summary: Evaluation of staged endoscopic thoracoscopic sympathicotomy in treatment of palmo-axillo-plantar hyperhidrosis
DOC.brief_title: Staged Extended Thoracoscopic Sympathicotomy for Palmo-axillo-plantar Hyperhidrosis
DOC.detailed_description: This is a pilot study that investigates the efficacy of video-assisted endoscopic sympathicotomy from the level of T3 to T12 on combined palmar and plantar hyperhidrosis. Ablation of ascending sympathetic fibers would help alleviating both types of hyperhidrosis in a single setting.
DOC.criteria: patients with combined palmoaxilloplantar hyperhidrosis of ASA grade I and II Patients under 16 years. Patients with bradycardia (heart rate <80 beats per minute). Patients with concomitant lung pathology, frozen mediastinum, pleural effusion, or history of intercostal tube insertion. Patients with cardiac problems with ejection fraction less than 60%. Patient suffering from isolated palmoaxillary hyperhidrosis not associated with plantar hyperhidrosis. Patients suffering from craniofacial hyperhidrosis, either isolated or combined with other areas of hyperhidrosis.
